intro: Leptochilus laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to North America. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in a fine pubescence. Leptochilus laurentii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
